channel.title: JavaDevo - Website Development Page
channel.description:
[B]Welcome to the JavaDevo Development Thread! Background:[/B] When I began learning Java I always thought, "There's not really many sites that actually teach you how to code Java." And Oracle Tutorials are so messy and it doesn't give you a forum so people can help you solve your problems (I think they don't anyhow). So I decided to make my own Java tutorial website that will hopefully have a nice staff and some active users both Masters and Beginners in Java. And plus, I thought it would be a nice little side project for me to do. This site will be used for an online Java tutorial database, some will be from users putting in their own programs and others will be from Moderators and Certified Java "Guru's" if you may.
[B]Website Development:[/B] [url=http://www.javadevo.net84.net]Website Link[/url] Homepage Admin Contol Panel News Feed Hello World! Tutorial User Ranks Forums - my own forum base, not VB or SMF Login/Register/Logout - Finished, but will be improved. Code view for easy to read access - restarted to make better Users online counter Total registered counter Total tutorials counter Profile Page - Done but i'm going to add a recent activity system. Mobile site
[b]Please note if you do go to the site, a lot of the features are not completely finished (Profile Page) and there's only 2 tutorials and I still haven't made an Admin Control Panel.[/b] MEDIA - Just go to the [url=http://www.javadevo.net84.net]site[/url] Current Ranks: [IMG]http://javadevo.net84.net/img/5.png[/img] [IMG]http://javadevo.net84.net/img/3.png[/img] [img]http://javadevo.net84.net/img/4.png[/img]
Example of Code View [IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/10rqqmw.png[/img]
Example of News Feed (HOMEPAGE) [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/21bnghu.png[/img]
[b]Please Leave Some Feedback[/b]

item.title: JavaDevo - Website Development Page
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

i never said ‘word for word,’ i said ‘nearly’ so you should always proof read before tossing yourself into dumbfounded conclusions like that. and i don’t say that you need help because you nearly copied a tutorial [yes, that is one aspect of my reasoning], though because with what you say; it appears to me that you just act smart with little to no knowledge about Java.

no, you can boldly see the CSS designing in that site. make a website solely out of the mark up language and make it appear as such. it’s also not hard to figure out which website is powered by what. yes; you will need to use the mark up language to fully enable your website, though you should use as much PHP or whichever language you prefer for website development.

yet we aren’t in pre-k are we? most of us are young adults to more mature adults pushing in their twenties. if they’re still learning the basics, use the proper terms, make it more difficult to understand. that way; they’ll be learning the more enlightened way instead of your;
“when creating a java (.java) file…”
which sounds deficient.

Read full topic

item.title: JavaDevo - Website Development Page
item.dc:creator: @Bubbler Bubbler
item.description:
@Bubbler wrote:

The comments are maybe the only place word for word and its for 2 sentences and oooooo I copied comments I need help learning Java cause I copied comments, show me where else I went word for word? That site looks HTML still. Every looks HTML still. All sites look HTML you don’t know if its PHP or Asp powered. Or CSS for that matter because there’s HTML attributes that do the same thing as CSS its just easier to use CSS. And if you thought I didn’t use CSS then you are just dumb. And when you are in pre-k you don’t learn the big words first you learn little words and then your vocabulary grows as you get more expiernced, I was simply trying to teach the beginners basics and eventually they would lead themselves to more intermediate terminology and programming

Read full topic

item.title: JavaDevo - Website Development Page
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Bubbler, post:6, topic:446295”]Every site looks like its HTML? Haha[/quote]http://www.danstyled.com/images/showcase/Css-Box-Web-Design-Doncaster.jpg
now idk about you; but that doesn’t look like it’s in HTML to me.

[quote=“Bubbler, post:6, topic:446295”]Also I mean I can re-word it to be more basic and easier to understand. Also I didn’t leech anything? I looked at the tutorial and made it my own, that’s not leeching, if it is then everybody who codes Java is a leecher because everyone takes info from Java and applys it to make it their own, which is exactly what I did. So you sir are very misunderstood[/quote]why reword something to make it ‘basic’ and ‘easy to understand’ when
1; it’s some of the most simplest methods to use in Java.
2; making it sound basic only has other members lack a vocabulary for developing.

also, you didn’t apply yourself in the slightest. you basically copied a simple tutorial word for word. applying yourself would be taking what you’ve learned throughout the years and turning it into whatever you decide to develop. ‘so you sir are very misunderstood’

Read full topic

item.title: JavaDevo - Website Development Page
item.dc:creator: @Bubbler Bubbler
item.description:
@Bubbler wrote:

Every site looks like its HTML? Haha
Also I mean I can re-word it to be more basic and easier to understand. Also I didn’t leech anything? I looked at the tutorial and made it my own, that’s not leeching, if it is then everybody who codes Java is a leecher because everyone takes info from Java and applys it to make it their own, which is exactly what I did. So you sir are very misunderstood

Side note: I think I explained it pretty well for beginners to understand actually.

Read full topic

item.title: JavaDevo - Website Development Page
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

yes i know, that’s why i said that you need help with Java. you just leeched another’s work – unable to explain it yourself, even though it was very basic. very basic, yet you still leeched. “Also, the tutorials are from oracle just reworded better…” are you saying you can explain code better than the original writers of Java? that’s a very bold statement.

as for the site; i never said there wasn’t developing languages within it, i simply stated it just appeared to be written with HTML.
“nice try”

Read full topic

item.title: JavaDevo - Website Development Page
item.dc:creator: @Bubbler Bubbler
item.description:
@Bubbler wrote:

I basically copied and pasted that tutorial from oracle, so I guess the writers if Java suck hm? And no this is not just a markup langauge there’s a lot of PHP and Javascript code, like the news feed and code colorer (all made by me). And I’m not releasing my code work to prove it, when it comes out you’ll see. Also, the tutorials are from oracle just reworded better so people can understand also that thread I compiled in like 5 mins this I’m actually taking my time with. And there isn’t anything wrong with that tutorial, everything I taught was taught correctly. Its just beginner stuff, which the title did say “beginner”

Also on a side note:
70% of my home page is PHP, nice try

Read full topic

item.title: JavaDevo - Website Development Page
item.dc:creator: @Bubbler Bubbler
item.description:
@Bubbler wrote:

Welcome to the JavaDevo Development Thread!
Background:
When I began learning Java I always thought, “There’s not really many sites that actually teach you how to code Java.” And Oracle Tutorials are so messy and it doesn’t give you a forum so people can help you solve your problems (I think they don’t anyhow). So I decided to make my own Java tutorial website that will hopefully have a nice staff and some active users both Masters and Beginners in Java. And plus, I thought it would be a nice little side project for me to do. This site will be used for an online Java tutorial database, some will be from users putting in their own programs and others will be from Moderators and Certified Java “Guru’s” if you may.

Website Development: Website Link
Homepage
Admin Contol Panel
News Feed
Hello World! Tutorial
User Ranks
Forums - my own forum base, not VB or SMF
Login/Register/Logout - Finished, but will be improved.
Code view for easy to read access - restarted to make better
Users online counter
Total registered counter
Total tutorials counter
Profile Page - Done but i’m going to add a recent activity system.
Mobile site

Please note if you do go to the site, a lot of the features are not completely finished (Profile Page) and there’s only 2 tutorials and I still haven’t made an Admin Control Panel.
MEDIA - Just go to the site
Current Ranks:

Example of Code View

10rqqmw.png724×612

Example of News Feed (HOMEPAGE)

21bnghu.png713×613

Please Leave Some Feedback
